file_content.text: I know. I couldn't help but take this place in, either. Reminds me of a song I wrote.
I feel like I'm being watched.
This place is unsettling....
I wouldn't have pegged you for a songwriter.
You wrote a song? You?
I'd like to hear that. Just a few bars?
Care to sing it?
Without accompaniment? I'm not that brave.
You seem nothing at all like the person I met in the swamp.
Being a Knight means everything, but I don't let it define me.
When it's time to go to work, I'm who I need to be. The rest of the time, I'm just me.
You don't strike me as all that different.
What do you mean?
How so?
I'm always me. It's as simple as that.
I am who I am.
I'm not always a Jedi.
Your Jedi Code. I've heard it recited. It's interesting.
Wouldn't work for me, I don't think. Definitely wouldn't work for Arcann.
I'm glad we could talk one to one.
You know, I get that a lot. Probably because most people meet me when I'm terse and angry.
I can stop looking at you. Maybe that will help? There.
Better...? No? Worth a try.
Parts of who you are have no place in war. They can't survive.
I'm not.
I think that's true, but it's hard to help sometimes. Someone like Arcann can make things unavoidably personal.
"You're an outlaw." "No, you're a vital asset in the war." "No, now you're a pirate outlaw!" Enough to make your head spin.
It's exhausting.
Think of it this way: you can be a "vital pirate outlaw asset" in the war against Arcann.
I'm not always a Sith Lord.
I live by a code, but I don't follow it to the letter.
I've heard your code. Victory from passion. It's a powerful notion. Very much like how Arcann operates.
The things I have to do on the job stay on the job, if that's what you mean.
I don't let work get to me.
Exactly. Though I think some things we can't help but be haunted by. Like having worked under Arcann.
Whatever the situation requires of me, that's who I become.
I've had many faces.
I imagine that can get complicated. But it will make you useful against Arcann.
I get the feeling you aren't entirely yourself when matters call for it.
Like me, I think you send parts of yourself deep down when it's appropriate.
I think that's true of a lot of people. I like to think it's even true of Arcann.
I think that's fine, but expect your sense of self to be tested if you confront Arcann.
I know why I oppose him. What's your reason?
Years after the death of our Immortal Emperor, most are still so afflicted with remorse that they don't see what's happening.
Arcann has become oppressive and cruel. He'll crush anyone who doesn't share his plan for the galaxy.
So that's me. What about you?
Arcann wants to lay waste to everything I've fought for and accomplished. I won't let him.
I'm trying to save the galaxy.
Neither will I. I may not know much of the worlds you've inhabited, but I do know what he's doing to them.
Everything I've done has brought me here. I'm supposed to face Arcann. To stop him.
It's my destiny.
Careful with that. Destiny can cloud your judgment more than doubt ever could. Or rum.
Arcann took five years of my life. Turned everything inside out. He has to pay.
I want revenge.
I know what that's like. Not exactly, but I see where you're coming from.
You're not what I expected. Not sure if that's good or bad yet, but I do know I'll have an easier time with you than Koth.
I hope you'll try to get along. The more we work together, the better off we'll be.
Please make an attempt.
Just because he betrayed our enemy doesn't change the fact that he was a traitor. You need to be cautious.
I don't trust either of you.
You're both strangers to me.
That's fair. But I think you'll come to find one of us is more trustworthy than the other.
If either of you makes this difficult for me, the Gravestone is equipped with several airlocks.
Anyone crosses me, they die.
When the time comes for us to confront Arcann, that might be just the kind of conviction we'll need.
Valkorion lives. He is not himself, nor has he taken a new body. It is difficult to see...
...and yet it is unmistakable.
His presence in the Force has always been deceptive.
Like on the Yavin moon.
Yes, and many times before and since.
Even when my life depended on it, I did not see him properly until it was too late....
When it's time to go to work, I'm who I need to be. The rest of the time, I'm just myself.
